channel.title: Port forwarding
channel.description: ok i connect to internet automatically when i turn on pc, how can i coonect myself , connect net when i want. and how can i forward port for cs, i think that my local ip 192.x.x.x should redirect to 78 .x.x.x ip (external) how to do that? my modem is intracom jetspeed 520 thnx ;D

item.title: Port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

in cmd, type “ipconfig”

Write down you default gateway

type that into your browser

that should give you access to your routers config

you will prbably need a user name and password.

Then forwarded the ports you your ip should be piss easy from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Your router should have a configuration page. 192.168.2.1 in the address bar should bring it up. If it’s isn’t, have a look in Google. There, you can find something called Virtual servers (if not, again, Google it). A lot of routers have drop down lists of programs they can do automatically, if yours doesn’t, just do it manually by entering the port numbers you need to forward.

Read full topic
